result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas Dion Johannsen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
- Sign up for Probation on 09/07/22 by 02:00 PM

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

11:37 AM CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: K. Anderson, Attorney Erica Ellenwood in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney A.W. Schutte in court for Nicholas Dion Johannsen. Defendant Nicholas Dion Johannsen in court. INCLUDES 22CM163, 22CM287, 22CM371 and 22CM416,  Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads GUILTY to Cts 1 and 2 - Misd Bail Jumping in 22CM287 and Ct 2 - Disorderly Conduct with Domestic Abuse Modifier in 22CM416. DE sworn. Court reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Court finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Cts 1 and 2 - Misd Bail Jumping in 22CM287 and Ct 2 - Disorderly Conduct with Domestic Abuse Modifier in 22CM416. On motion of the State without objection, Court dismisses Cts 1, 3-8 in 22CM416 and cases 22CM163 and 22CM371 in their entirety. Sentencing recommendations.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial/scheduling conference on May 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Includes 22CM287 and 22CM163.

$250 bond on file.

-  It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Melissa P. or County Market. The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

-   Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

-   I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required to submit to random alcohol random ETG testing at least 1 times per week. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

I understand that I must IMMEDIATELY report to the Justice Support Center located adjacent to the lower parking lot of the St. Croix County Government Center. If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.
